page.title: 06Local news in Pitsea-June 85
page.content: Danielle Wilson answered the phone and said" Pitsea School. Can I help you?" The voice said,"There's a bomb in the school. You've got 20 minutes to get out".Danielle ran to tell her mum,who told Mrs North.The children all ran onto the field and stood there while the Police checked the school.There was no bomb! A thanks giving service was held at our school for Mr.D.Williams who had died of pneumonia. He was head of the Chess Club at Pitsea Junior School and had taught at the school for 27 years and retired a year ago.A tree is going to be planted in memory of him. Basildon Council are going to have a talk about St.Michael's church,Pitsea. It is no longer used and the Council are planning to turn it into a museum. Sarah French.
